objects.description: [Industroyer](https://collaborate.mitre.org/attackics/index.php/Software/S0001) s OPC DA module also uses IOPCBrowseServerAddressSpace to look for items with the following strings: 'ctlSelOn', 'ctlOperOn', 'ctlSelOff', 'ctlOperOff', 'Pos and stVal'.(Citation: ESET Win32/Industroyer June 2017)

external_references.description: Anton Cherepanov, ESET. (2017, June 12). Win32/Industroyer: A new threat for industrial control systems. Retrieved September 15, 2017.
